name: DInas Island Circular Walk, Dinas Island, North Pembroke

ai.summary: Dinas Island Circular Walk is an 11.1 km coastal circuit in the UK, offering a moderate challenge with varied terrain and sea views around Dinas Island in North Pembrokeshire. The route combines grassy uplands, rocky sections and exposed coast, returning to the start via well-marked paths.
ai.terrain_summary: A coastal trail with a mix of grassy lanes, rocky outcrops and uneven footing. Expect exposed sections with narrow paths, some climbs and descents, and potential mud after rain. Parts may have sea-washed edges along the coastline.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather forecasts and tide times before setting out. Stay on marked paths, keep a safe distance from cliff edges, and be prepared for sudden changes in wind or rain. Wear sturdy footwear and carry a map or GPS, water, snacks, a basic first-aid kit, a whistle, and a fully charged phone. Inform someone of your plans and turn back if conditions become unsafe.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or shoes with good grip
Map and/or GPS device (or a charged phone with offline maps)
Whistle and basic first aid kit
Head torch or waterproof bag for electronics (optional)
Tide-aware navigation if a coastal crossing is involved
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May to September) offer milder, drier weather and longer daylight; spring is ideal for wildflowers, while autumn provides quieter trails but weather can be variable.

seo.title: Dinas Island Circular Walk - 11.1 km Moderate Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Plan your Dinas Island Circular Walk: an 11.1 km moderate coastal hike with cliff-top views, varied terrain and practical safety tips for spring to autumn in the UK.
